The Vegetarian Pepita was delicious and a welcome break from fish.  It was served with a nice portion of sautéed spinach on the side and a delicious olive paste.  The bread is slices so thin it is more like a salad than a sandwich.  The bread is toasted and crispy so I cut it up like croutons.  Sangria was good but the smallest serving I've had in a week in Spain.La Pepita was busy at 3:00 so instead of waiting for a table we were quickly seated at the bar.  Friendly and attentive service.  If there weren't so many planes to try in a limited amount I time in Barcelona, I'd go there again.
